ranked_diseases.explanation: Classic presentation with global developmental delay, severely delayed speech (often absent), delayed walking, and dental abnormalities (widely spaced teeth, prognathism) are characteristic features.
Features global developmental delay, speech delay, motor delays, and dental abnormalities (missing teeth, malocclusion) as common manifestations.
X-linked disorder affecting males with intellectual disability, delayed motor milestones, speech delay, and characteristic dental anomalies (hypodontia, wide-spaced teeth).
Most common inherited cause of intellectual disability in males, presenting with global developmental delay, significant speech delay, motor delays, and dental crowding/malocclusion.
Characterized by developmental delays, delayed motor milestones, language delays (though relative strength later), and dental abnormalities including small teeth and malocclusion.
Features moderate intellectual disability, delayed motor development, speech delays, and dental anomalies including crowded teeth and high palate.
Presents with intellectual disability, speech and language delays, motor delays, and dental problems including premature tooth eruption and dental caries.
Characterized by intellectual disability, severe speech delays, motor delays, and dental abnormalities including delayed tooth eruption and widely spaced teeth.
